title: Screener Metadata
text:
Download Full Metadata


Here is a link ***to the metadata-xvars.csv for the creation of predictive screening tools. This metadata is to be used in tandem with the Adolescent Brain Cognitive Development (ABCD) Study data.
Here is a link to the metadata-xvars.xlsx, containing all columns from the ABCD 6.0 metadata release AND all columns the Pelham Lab used to sort and recode variables.

title: Tools for Survey-Based Prediction in ABCD
text:
If you have a question that is not currently addressed here, please reach out to <wpelham at ucsd dot edu>.


TSP-ABCD was initially conceptualized as a predictive tool for high-risk, early substance use. As such, the lab prioritized evaluating whether variables could be considered items when they did not contain youth substance use. We are currently working on evaluating these variables and will update the metadata on this website once we have finished. Here is a spreadsheet containing all potential items flagged for youth substance use.



You can find more details about our procedure for creating here.

title: About TSP-ABCD
text:
This is the website for navigating Tools for Survey-Based Prediction in the Adolescent Brain Cognitive Development Study (TSP-ABCD). TSP-ABCD provides researchers familiar with the ABCD study with practical tools for the creation of predictive survey and / or screening models in the ABCD Study.
Pelham Lab research assistants evaluated every variable in the ABCD 6.0 release under the supervision of Dr. William Pelham III to ensure that TSP-ABCD consists only of variables considered viable items for use in a predictive screening battery.
Pelham Lab Predictive Screening Tools Metadata, a tool for building predictive screening tools with the Adolescent Brain Cognitive Development (ABCD) study dataset.
Pelham Lab Metadata (metadata-ABCD-items.csv) consists only of variables considered viable items for use in a predictive screening battery.
Pelham Lab research assistants evaluated the entirety of the metadata from the ABCD 6.0 release under the supervision of Dr. William Pelham III. Variables were first evaluated on the basis of viability as a question on a survey. If a variable could be a survey question, it was then evaluated on the following: a) administration of the variable in the core study (such that all eligible ABCD participants could have completed the variable) , b) administration of the variable happening outside of the eligibility screener, c) if gating is present, the variable’s ability to be combined with the gating question(s) to produce a straightforward single question with a single set of responses with a monotonic relationship with the outcomes , and d) any other reason that would make presenting the variable on a predictive screening battery difficult. More information on how we created the bespoke metadata can be found here.

More information on how we created the bespoke metadata can be found here.

title: Tools for Survey-Based Prediction in ABCD
text:
Introduction
This is a user’s guide to navigating the Pelham Lab’s ABCD metadata spreadsheet (metadata-ABCD-items.csv). The csv file contains several columns meant to help navigate the ABCD dataset while working in R or similar statistical programming languages.

Please scroll horizontally to view the entirety of the table


Column
Origin
Contents




study
ABCD metadata
the study the item is derived from (Core or N/A) * might go ahead and delete this column


domain
ABCD metadata
a sorting system that all ABCD 6.0 release variables were sorted into


sub_domain
ABCD metadata
a subsystem within domain that all ABCD 6.0 release variables were sorted into


source
ABCD metadata
allows us to quickly tell who the respondent/subject was


table_name
ABCD metadata
collections of ABCD variables that were administered and/or collected together


name
ABCD metadata and Pelham Lab
name of the variable; mostly derived from ABCD 6.0 metadata; some created by the Pelham Lab through manipulation


label
ABCD metadata and Pelham Lab
describes the contents of the variable in more detail


has_branching_logic
Pelham Lab
a yes/no indication of the presence of gating


sensitivity
Pelham Lab
an evaluation of how sensitive the content of the variable is


plab_facet
Pelham Lab
a sorting system that all ABCD 6.0 release variables and Pelham Lab variables were sorted into


plab_subfacet
Pelham Lab
a subsystem within domain that all ABCD 6.0 release and Pelham Lab variables were sorted into


alexsa_facet
Pelham Lab
utilizes the subscales from the Assessment of Liability and EXposure to Substance use and Antisocial behavior for Children (ALEXSA) assessment (Ridenour et al., 2009) to sort variables into



Pelham Lab Metadata (metadata-ABCD-items.csv) consists only of variables considered viable items for use in a predictive screening battery. The full metadata containing all columns from the ABCD 6.0 metadata release AND all columns the Pelham Lab used to sort and recode variables can be found here.
Pelham Lab research assistants evaluated the entirety of the metadata from the ABCD 6.0 release under the supervision of Dr. William Pelham III. Variables were first evaluated on the basis of viability as a question on a survey. If a variable could be a survey question, it was then evaluated on the following: a) administration of the variable in the core study (such that all eligible ABCD participants could have completed the variable) , b) administration of the variable happening outside of the eligibility screener, c) if gating is present, the variable’s ability to be combined with the gating question(s) to produce a straightforward single question with a single set of responses with a monotonic relationship with the outcomes , and d) any other reason that would make presenting the variable on a predictive screening battery difficult. More information on how we created the bespoke metadata can be found here.


study


domain


sub_domain


source


table_name


name


label


has_branching_logic


sensitivity


plab_facet


plab_subfacet


alexsa_facet
